intro: Neobesseya dasyacantha, commonly known as the woolly bottle tree, is a unique and striking plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its thick, bottle-shaped trunk covered in a dense layer of white, woolly hair. The plant produces showy, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, adding to its ornamental appeal. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Neobesseya dasyacantha is adapted to arid environments, making it a resilient choice for xeriscaping in dry climates.
